G0A08.ans_a: A. Post a copy of FCC Part 97.13 in the station
G0A08.ans_b: B. Post a copy of OET Bulletin 65 in the station
G0A08.ans_c: C. Perform a routine RF exposure evaluation
G0A08.ans_d: D. Contact the FCC for a visit to conduct a station evaluation

G0A09.question: What type of instrument can be used to accurately measure an RF field?
G0A09.ans_a: A. A receiver with an S meter
G0A09.ans_b: B. A calibrated field strength meter with a calibrated antenna
G0A09.ans_c: C. An SWR meter with a peak-reading function
G0A09.ans_d: D. An oscilloscope with a high-stability crystal marker generator

G0A10.question: What is one thing that can be done if evaluation shows that a neighbor might receive more than the allowable limit of RF exposure from the main lobe of a directional antenna?
G0A10.ans_a: A. Change to a non-polarized antenna with higher gain
G0A10.ans_b: B. Post a warning sign that is clearly visible to the neighbor
G0A10.ans_c: C. Use an antenna with a higher front-to-back ratio
G0A10.ans_d: D. Take precautions to ensure that the antenna cannot be pointed in their direction

G0A11.question: What precaution should you take if you install an indoor transmitting antenna?
G0A11.ans_a: A. Locate the antenna close to your operating position to minimize feed-line radiation
G0A11.ans_b: B. Position the antenna along the edge of a wall to reduce parasitic radiation
G0A11.ans_c: C. Make sure that MPE limits are not exceeded in occupied areas
G0A11.ans_d: D. Make sure the antenna is properly shielded

G0B01.question: Which wire or wires in a four-conductor connection should be attached to fuses or circuit breakers in a device operated from a 240 VAC single phase source?
G0B01.ans_a: A. Only the two wires carrying voltage

G0B02.question: According the National Electrical Code, what is the minimum wire size that may be used safely for wiring with a 20 ampere circuit breaker?

G0B03.question: Which size of fuse or circuit breaker would be appropriate to use with a circuit that uses AWG number 14 wiring?

G0B04.question: Which of the following is a primary reason for not placing a gasoline-fueled generator inside an occupied area?
G0B04.ans_a: A. Danger of carbon monoxide poisoning
G0B04.ans_b: B. Danger of engine over torque
G0B04.ans_c: C. Lack of oxygen for adequate combustion
G0B04.ans_d: D. Lack of nitrogen for adequate combustion

G0B05.question: Which of the following conditions will cause a Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter (GFCI) to disconnect the 120 or 240 Volt AC line power to a device?
G0B05.ans_a: A. Current flowing from one or more of the voltage-carrying wires to the neutral wire
G0B05.ans_b: B. Current flowing from one or more of the voltage-carrying wires directly to ground
G0B05.ans_c: C. Overvoltage on the voltage-carrying wires
G0B05.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct

G0B06.question: Which of the following is covered by the National Electrical Code?
G0B06.ans_c: C. Electrical safety inside the ham shack
G0B06.ans_d: D. RF exposure limits of the human body

G0B07.question: Which of these choices should be observed when climbing a tower using a safety belt or harness?
G0B07.ans_a: A. Never lean back and rely on the belt alone to support your weight
G0B07.ans_b: B. Confirm that the belt is rated for the weight of the climber and that it is within its allowable service life
G0B07.ans_c: C. Ensure that all heavy tools are securely fastened to the belt D-ring
G0B07.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct

G0B08.question: What should be done by any person preparing to climb a tower that supports electrically powered devices?
G0B08.ans_a: A. Notify the electric company that a person will be working on the tower
G0B08.ans_b: B. Make sure all circuits that supply power to the tower are locked out and tagged
G0B08.ans_c: C. Unground the base of the tower
G0B08.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct

G0B09.question: Which of the following is true of an emergency generator installation?
G0B09.ans_a: A. The generator should be located in a well-ventilated area
G0B09.ans_b: B. The generator must be insulated from ground
G0B09.ans_c: C. Fuel should be stored near the generator for rapid refueling in case of an emergency
G0B09.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct

G0B10.question: Which of the following is a danger from lead-tin solder?
G0B10.ans_a: A. Lead can contaminate food if hands are not washed carefully after handling the solder
G0B10.ans_b: B. High voltages can cause lead-tin solder to disintegrate suddenly
G0B10.ans_c: C. Tin in the solder can “cold flow,” causing shorts in the circuit
G0B10.ans_d: D. RF energy can convert the lead into a poisonous gas

G0B11.question: Which of the following is good practice for lightning protection grounds?
G0B11.ans_a: A. They must be bonded to all buried water and gas lines
G0B11.ans_b: B. Bends in ground wires must be made as close as possible to a right angle
G0B11.ans_c: C. Lightning grounds must be connected to all ungrounded wiring
G0B11.ans_d: D. They must be bonded together with all other grounds

G0B12.question: What is the purpose of a power supply interlock?
G0B12.ans_a: A. To prevent unauthorized changes to the circuit that would void the manufacturer’s warranty
G0B12.ans_b: B. To shut down the unit if it becomes too hot
G0B12.ans_c: C. To ensure that dangerous voltages are removed if the cabinet is opened
G0B12.ans_d: D. To shut off the power supply if too much voltage is produced

G0B13.question: What must you do when powering your house from an emergency generator?
G0B13.ans_a: A. Disconnect the incoming utility power feed
G0B13.ans_b: B. Insure that the generator is not grounded
G0B13.ans_c: C. Insure that all lightning grounds are disconnected
G0B13.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct

G0B14.question: What precaution should you take whenever you adjust or repair an antenna?
G0B14.ans_a: A. Ensure that you and the antenna structure are grounded
G0B14.ans_b: B. Turn off the transmitter and disconnect the feed line
G0B14.ans_d: D. All these choices are correct
